summary: The Department of Energy is responsible for cleaning groundwater contamination that poses threats to public health and the environment. At 4 sites we examined, of the 13 involved, DOE is cleaning groundwater to drinking water standards. Site officials estimated these efforts will collectively cost at least $10 billion over the next 5 decades. However, DOE doesn't have comprehensive information on cleanup progress at all 13...
title: Nuclear Waste Cleanup: DOE Should Use Available Information to Measure the Effectiveness of Its Groundwater Efforts
